page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = UI_BITMAP_LOAD(C name,B bitmap_data)

argument.name: name
argument.description: The name of the bitmap to create.

argument.name: bitmap_data
argument.description: The blob variable containing the image data.

page.description: Load a bitmap from a blob into the bitmap cache, returns TRUE if succeeded.
page.discussion: UI_BITMAP_LOAD() creates a new bitmap in memory from the data in a blob variable. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.description: Get the original color image, then extract the color data and the alpha channel data.
section.example: png_data = file.to_blob("c:\documents\Xbasic Reference\Images\toucan.png") rgb_data = png_to_bitmap(png_data, "R") trans_data = png_to_bitmap(png_data, "A")

section.description: Create two bitmaps from the color data and the alpha channel data.
Calculate the positions of the three images.
section.example: pixsize = ui_bitmap_info_get(rgb_data, "w,h") xpix = valpixsize, 1, ","? ypix = valpixsize, 2, ","? xperin = ui_info(4) yperin = ui_info(5) width = xpix/xperin height = ypix/yperin

ui_bitmap_create("combine", width, height) stone_data = file.to_blob("C:\WINDOWS\Greenstone.bmp") ui_bitmap_load("Stone", stone_data) ui_bitmap_draw("combine", <<%code% bitmap("stone", 0, 0) bitmap_alpha("rgb", 0, 0, "trans") %code%)
